trans-unit.source: Add Azure Storage by using Connected Services in Visual Studio | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Add Azure Storage by using Connected Services in Visual Studio | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Add Azure Storage to your app by using the Visual Studio Add Connected Services dialog box
trans-unit.target: Add Azure Storage to your app by using the Visual Studio Add Connected Services dialog box

trans-unit.source: Adding Azure storage by using Visual Studio Connected Services
trans-unit.target: Adding Azure storage by using Visual Studio Connected Services

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: With Visual Studio 2015, you can connect any C# cloud service, .NET backend mobile service, ASP.NET website or service, ASP.NET 5 service, or Azure WebJob service to Azure Storage by using the Add Connected Services dialog.
trans-unit.target: With Visual Studio 2015, you can connect any C# cloud service, .NET backend mobile service, ASP.NET website or service, ASP.NET 5 service, or Azure WebJob service to Azure Storage by using the Add Connected Services dialog.

trans-unit.source: The connected service functionality adds all the needed references and connection code, and modifies your configuration files appropriately.
trans-unit.target: The connected service functionality adds all the needed references and connection code, and modifies your configuration files appropriately.

trans-unit.source: The dialog also takes you to documentation that tells you what the next steps are to start blob storage, queues, and tables.
trans-unit.target: The dialog also takes you to documentation that tells you what the next steps are to start blob storage, queues, and tables.

trans-unit.source: Supported Project Types
trans-unit.target: Supported Project Types

trans-unit.source: You can use the Connected Services dialog to connect to Azure Storage in the following project types.
trans-unit.target: You can use the Connected Services dialog to connect to Azure Storage in the following project types.

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET Web Projects
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET Web Projects

trans-unit.source: ASP.NET 5 Projects
trans-unit.target: ASP.NET 5 Projects

trans-unit.source: .NET Cloud Service Web Role and Worker Role Projects
trans-unit.target: .NET Cloud Service Web Role and Worker Role Projects

trans-unit.source: .NET Mobile Services Projects
trans-unit.target: .NET Mobile Services Projects

trans-unit.source: Azure WebJob Projects
trans-unit.target: Azure WebJob Projects

trans-unit.source: Connect to Azure Storage using the Connected Services dialog
trans-unit.target: Connect to Azure Storage using the Connected Services dialog

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an Azure account, you can sign up for a <link><linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an Azure account, you can sign up for a <link><linkText>free trial</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Once you have an Azure account, you can create storage accounts, create mobile services, and configure Azure Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: Once you have an Azure account, you can create storage accounts, create mobile services, and configure Azure Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: Open your project in Visual Studio, open the context menu for the References node in Solution Explorer, and then choose Add Connected Service.
trans-unit.target: Open your project in Visual Studio, open the context menu for the References node in Solution Explorer, and then choose Add Connected Service.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Adding a connected service</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Adding a connected service</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Add Connected Service dialog box, choose Azure Storage, and then choose the Configure button.
trans-unit.target: In the Add Connected Service dialog box, choose Azure Storage, and then choose the Configure button.

trans-unit.source: You may be prompted to log into Azure if you haven't already done so.
trans-unit.target: You may be prompted to log into Azure if you haven't already done so.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add Connected Service dialog box - Storage</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add Connected Service dialog box - Storage</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Storage dialog box, choose an existing storage account and then click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Storage dialog box, choose an existing storage account and then click Add.

trans-unit.source: If you need to create a new storage account, go to the next step.
trans-unit.target: If you need to create a new storage account, go to the next step.

trans-unit.source: Otherwise, skip to step 6.
trans-unit.target: Otherwise, skip to step 6.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Storage dialog box</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Storage dialog box</linkText>

trans-unit.source: To create a new storage account:
trans-unit.target: To create a new storage account:

trans-unit.source: Choose the Create a New Storage Account button at the bottom of the Azure Storage dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Choose the Create a New Storage Account button at the bottom of the Azure Storage dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Fill out the Create Storage Account dialog box and then choose the Create button.
trans-unit.target: Fill out the Create Storage Account dialog box and then choose the Create button.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure Storage dialog box</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure Storage dialog box</linkText>

trans-unit.source: When you're back in the Azure Storage dialog box, the new storage appears in the list.
trans-unit.target: When you're back in the Azure Storage dialog box, the new storage appears in the list.

trans-unit.source: Select the new storage in the list and click Add.
trans-unit.target: Select the new storage in the list and click Add.

trans-unit.source: The storage connected service appears under the Service References node of your WebJob project.
trans-unit.target: The storage connected service appears under the Service References node of your WebJob project.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Azure storage in web jobs project</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Azure storage in web jobs project</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Review the Getting Started page that appears and find out how your project was modified.
trans-unit.target: Review the Getting Started page that appears and find out how your project was modified.

trans-unit.source: A Getting Started page appears in your browser whenever you add a connected service.
trans-unit.target: A Getting Started page appears in your browser whenever you add a connected service.

trans-unit.source: You can review the suggested next steps and code examples, or switch to the What Happened page to see what references were added to your project, and how your code and configuration files were modified.
trans-unit.target: You can review the suggested next steps and code examples, or switch to the What Happened page to see what references were added to your project, and how your code and configuration files were modified.

trans-unit.source: How your project is modified
trans-unit.target: How your project is modified

trans-unit.source: When you finish the dialog, Visual Studio adds references and modifies certain configuration files.
trans-unit.target: When you finish the dialog, Visual Studio adds references and modifies certain configuration files.

trans-unit.source: The specific changes depend on the project type.
trans-unit.target: The specific changes depend on the project type.

trans-unit.source: For ASP.NET projects, see <link><linkText>What happened – ASP.NET Projects</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For ASP.NET projects, see <link><linkText>What happened – ASP.NET Projects</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For ASP.NET 5 projects, see <link><linkText>What happened – ASP.NET 5 Projects</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For ASP.NET 5 projects, see <link><linkText>What happened – ASP.NET 5 Projects</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For cloud service projects (web roles and worker roles), see <link><linkText>What happened – Cloud Service projects</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For cloud service projects (web roles and worker roles), see <link><linkText>What happened – Cloud Service projects</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: For WebJob projects, see [What
trans-unit.target: For WebJob projects, see [What

trans-unit.source: happened - WebJob projects](vs-storage-webjobs-what-happened/).
trans-unit.target: happened - WebJob projects](vs-storage-webjobs-what-happened/).

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Using the Getting Started code samples as a guide, create the type of storage that you want, and then start writing code to access your storage account!
trans-unit.target: Using the Getting Started code samples as a guide, create the type of storage that you want, and then start writing code to access your storage account!
